title: Full plates to paperwork: Federal cuts to free lunch program could burden WV schools

Kanawha County Schools provide no-cost meals to over 21,000 students daily through the Community Eligibility Provision, but federal policy changes may put this program at risk. Local officials are advocating to keep the initiative in place to prevent disruptions for families.

If proposed budget cuts move forward, hundreds of West Virginia schools could lose CEP eligibility, forcing students to reapply for meal benefits and reinstating lunch fees many families can’t afford. Here's what’s at stake and how it could impact students.
